availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert F. Allison (Todd County, Kentucky, farmer and Provisional Congress county commissioner (C.S.A))

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, farmer and Provisional Congress county commissioner (C.S.A). Kentucky native. Married Martha M. Burns in Todd County, Kentucky on April 30, 1849. Father of S. J. Allison. Farmer in Todd County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Todd County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned five enslaved people in Todd County, Kentucky in 1860. Provisional Congress county commissioner (C.S.A). Kentucky native. Elected as Provisional Congress commissioner of Warren County, Kentucky on December 11, 1861.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 1, p. 394. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 829. Find A Grave, "Robert F. Allison (October 13, 1823- January 18, 1884)," Memorial #53115629, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/53115629 (accessed January 7, 2020). Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Todd County Marriages, Film 000367186, p.53. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 370. KYR-0004-033-0025.
